Přední strana Zadní strana

docs.title: Konektor
docs.text:
Note

Tato deska je SPI SLAVE, proto je MISO na TX pinu RP2350

Konektor (pin) Signál RP2350 1 GND GND 2 5V 5V 3 5V 5V 4 MISO IO19 5 MOSI IO20 6 CS IO21 7 SCK IO22 8 GND GND 9 EX1 IO23 10 EX2 IO24

docs.title: DBG & PWR Led
docs.text:
• Debug/status led - IO26
  • Power led - 3V3

docs.title: Protocol
docs.text:
Board comunicates with the control board over SPI.

Display board is slave, controling board is host,

docs.title: Command code
docs.text:
8-bit value determining the command

Code Description 0x00 Ignore 0x0X Ping 0x1X Screen 0x2X USB

docs.title: Packet lenght
docs.text:
16-bit / uint16 number determining the lenght in bytes of the comming data (not including the command code or packet lenght)

TODO - little/big endian

docs.title: Data
docs.text: Predetermined lenght of bytes representing what should be done / what happened. For example the display buffer or usb device feedback.

docs.title: Padding (optional)
docs.text: Few bytes as a padding to make sure the recieving device recieves the correct amount of data

docs.title: Ping
docs.text: Code Description 0x01 Ping 0x02 Pong

docs.title: Request Format
docs.text:
[byte: 0x01]

Pings the connected device

docs.title: Response Format
docs.text:
[byte: 0x02]

Sends Pong back

docs.title: Request Format
docs.text:
[byte: 0x02]

Recieves pong back confirming everything works

docs.title: Screen
docs.text: Code Description 0x10 Write to buffer 0x12 Fill buffer with color

docs.title: Request Format
docs.text:
[byte: 0x10] [uint16: packet_length] [byte: color_format] [variable: pixel_data]

packet_lenght = width * height * color_format + 1

color_format: number of bytes per pixel

  • 2 = RGB565
  • 3 = RGB888

pixel_data = width * height * color

Writes pixel data to the buffer. The length field indicates the number of bytes.

docs.title: Request Format
docs.text:
[byte: 0x12] [uint16: packet lenght] [byte: color_format] [variable: color_data]

packet lenght = color_format + 1

color_format: number of bytes per pixel

  • 2 = RGB565
  • 3 = RGB888

color_data = RGB565

Fills the entire buffer with a single color.

docs.title: USB
docs.text: Code Description 0x20 Get device data

docs.title: Supported Device Types
docs.text:
• 0x00: No device connected
  • 0x01: Keyboard
  • 0x02: Mouse
  • 0x03: Gamepad
  • 0x04: Mass Storage

docs.title: Request
docs.text: Send 0x20 to pull queued USB reports from the attached device (only one device is supported).

docs.title: Response Format
docs.text:
[byte: 0x20] [uint16: packet_length] [byte: device_type] [byte: report_count] [reports...]
  • packet_length: bytes following this field.
  • report_count: number of reports included (0 when no data or no device).

docs.title: No Device (0x00)
docs.text: report_count is 0; no additional bytes.

docs.title: Keyboard (0x01)
docs.text:
Each report: 

[byte: modifier_keys] [byte: reserved] [6 bytes: key_codes]

Modifier Keys Flags: - Bit 0: Left Ctrl - Bit 1: Left Shift - Bit 2: Left Alt - Bit 3: Left GUI (Windows/Command) - Bit 4: Right Ctrl - Bit 5: Right Shift - Bit 6: Right Alt - Bit 7: Right GUI

docs.title: Mouse (0x02)
docs.text:
Each report: 

[byte: buttons] [byte: x_movement] [byte: y_movement] [byte: wheel]

Buttons: - Bit 0: Left button - Bit 1: Right button - Bit 2: Middle button - Bits 3-7: Reserved

docs.title: Gamepad (0x03)
docs.text:
Each report: 

[byte: buttons] [byte: lt_analog] [byte: rt_analog] [byte: lx_analog] [byte: ly_analog] [byte: rx_analog] [byte: ry_analog]

Buttons: - Bit 0: A / Cross - Bit 1: B / Circle - Bit 2: X / Square - Bit 3: Y / Triangle - Bit 4: LB / L1 - Bit 5: RB / R1 - Bit 6: Back / Select - Bit 7: Start
